meanings.definition: To get a hold of; to grasp or seize.
meanings.sent1: She quickly ahold the rope before it slipped away.
meanings.sent2: He always ahold the opportunity to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to ahold the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: The detective ahold the crucial piece of evidence in the case.
meanings.sent5: With determination, she ahold the handle and pulled with all her might.

meanings.definition: In one's possession or under one's control.
meanings.sent1: The keys were ahold in her pocket.
meanings.sent2: He felt secure knowing the situation was ahold.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was ahold of the nut, ready to enjoy it.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks left the audience ahold in wonder.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was firmly ahold by the pirate captain.
